headline: Top Analyst Reports for AbbVie, RTX & IBM
summary: AbbVie leads today's top analyst picks after beating Q4 estimates, while RTX and IBM also draw attention for strong results and growth drivers.

headline: Trump’s America First Agenda Is Pushing Industrial ETFs like XLI To The Moon
summary: The industrial sector doesn’t make headlines like tech stocks do, but it’s the machinery behind infrastructure spending, defense budgets, and manufacturing cycles. When GDP growth accelerates or governments commit to multi-year infrastructure plans, industrial companies see order books expand. That’s the core thesis behind The Industrial Select Sector SPDR Fund (NYSEARCA:XLI), which offers pure exposure ... Trump’s America First Agenda Is Pushing Industrial ETFs like XLI To The Moon

headline: RTX Weighs New Defense Contract And Vietjet Deal For Future Growth
summary: Raytheon, part of NYSE:RTX, secured a new contract to establish domestic thin film lithium niobate wafer production for secure communications and sensing in the U.S. Pratt & Whitney, also under RTX, agreed a major engine order and long-term maintenance partnership with Vietjet Air, expanding its footprint in Asia-Pacific aviation. For RTX, trading at $200.06, these developments sit alongside a share price that is up 6.8% year to date and 64.7% over the past year. The company has also...

headline: RTX's Collins Aerospace named a Crystal Cabin Award finalist
summary: Collins Aerospace, an RTX (NYSE: RTX) business, has been named a finalist for a 2026 Crystal Cabin Award for its SkyNook suite. The Crystal Cabin Award is an international honor recognizing innovation, excellence and creativity in aircraft cabin interior design that elevates the air travel experience.

headline: RTX's Raytheon to accelerate domestic supply of critical material for commercial and defense applications
summary: Raytheon, an RTX (NYSE: RTX) business, was awarded a contract from the Air Force Research Laboratory to develop a domestic production capability for thin film lithium niobate (TFLN) wafers, a material essential to high‑speed, secure communications and advanced sensing systems.
